nodes.speaker: narrator
nodes.text: First day of the new semester. The hallway feels a little louder, a little brighter... and full of posters you never noticed before.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: SUSTAINABILITY WEEK – Talks, clean-up events, food bank volunteering. Sign up at the cafeteria.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Oi, over here! You saw all the new posters around campus?

choices.text: Looks like extra work to me.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Yeah! Sustainable Development Goals. The uni is doing a whole week about it.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: They’re doing talks, clean-ups, even something with the campus food bank.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: SDG stands for Sustainable Development Goals. Stuff like education, equality, climate…

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Maybe. But if we’re already stuck here studying, might as well make it mean something.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: You don’t have to save the whole world lah, just do something small.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Anyway, the lecturer said today’s class is about it. If we’re late, that one is on you.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: New objective: Go to class.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: Good morning, everyone. Today we’re going to talk about something bigger than grades: the Sustainable Development Goals.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: There are 17 SDGs. They cover things like poverty, education, climate, equality… and we’re going to connect them to your lives here on campus.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: So, be honest. How many of you actually think students like you can make a difference?

choices.text: Maybe? But it feels far from us.
I don’t think we can do much.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: Exactly. Change usually starts with small groups who take things seriously. Campus is a perfect place to experiment.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: That’s fair. It can feel distant. That’s why your projects this semester will focus on real issues around you.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: I get that reaction a lot. But by the end of this semester, I hope you’ll prove yourself wrong.

nodes.speaker: professor
nodes.text: For example, some of your seniors worked with the campus food bank last year. They helped redistribute surplus food to students who needed it.

nodes.speaker: friend
nodes.text: (whispers) Food bank actually sounds kind of interesting, doesn’t it?

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: New idea unlocked: Campus Food Bank.

nodes.speaker: student
nodes.text: Honestly… I thought SDGs were just another poster thing. But the food bank example is actually real.

nodes.speaker: student
nodes.text: If we’re doing projects on real issues, I want one that actually helps someone — not just a slideshow.

nodes.speaker: student
nodes.text: You know what’s wild? A lot of people around us need help and we don’t notice… because everyone looks 'fine'.

nodes.speaker: student
nodes.text: If we can change stuff on campus first… maybe it won’t feel so impossible outside of campus.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: Poster: SDG 4 — Quality Education. Education isn't just exams; it’s access, support, and equal opportunity.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: Poster: SDG 13 — Climate Action. Small campus habits add up: energy use, waste, transport choices.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Over here! How was class?

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: Same. The SDG stuff makes everything feel… bigger than just assignments.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: Yeah, but at least it’s about something real. Not just theory.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: We were just talking about that food bank the lecturer mentioned. They’re asking for student helpers this week.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: They need people to help sort and pack food after classes. What do you think? Want to join?

choices.text: Maybe… I’ll see how my schedule is.
I don’t know if I’m the right person for that.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: Nice! We’ll go together. I’ll send you the details later.

nodes.speaker: friendB
nodes.text: That’s okay. Even one day helps. Just let us know when you’re free.

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: You don’t have to be perfect for this. You just have to care a little. Think about it, okay?

nodes.speaker: friendA
nodes.text: Anyway, drinks first, saving the world later.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: End of Chapter 1: Awareness Begins.
